content.title: Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities to Scheduled Castes by Establishing Livestock Units
content.details: The scheme is implemented to provide self-employment opportunities to Scheduled Castes by establishing Dairy units, Piggery units, and Sheep/Goat units. It aims to create self-employment opportunities, increase livestock productivity, and enhance the socio-economic status of Scheduled Castes families.
benefits: 50% subsidy on the cost of milch animals for establishing Dairy units of 2/3 milch animals
50% subsidy on the cost of livestock for establishing 10+1 Piggery units
90% subsidy on the cost of livestock for establishing 15+1 Sheep/Goat units
Financial assistance up to ₹50,000 for Piggery units and ₹88,200 for Sheep/Goat units
eligibility: Applicant must be 18 to 55 years of age and a resident of Haryana
Applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste community
No mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements
Applicant must have a space/shed for keeping animals
Previous beneficiaries of any Departmental Scheme for livestock units are not eligible
Self-Declaration for being unemployed is required
exclusions: Any group/firm/organization will not be permitted to apply under the Scheme
content.application_process: Online application through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
documents_required: Copy of Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque
Photo of Availability of shed/space for keeping animals

faqs.question: What is the primary objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective is to provide self-employment opportunities to Scheduled Castes by establishing livestock units.

faqs.question: What types of livestock units can be established under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries can establish Dairy units, Piggery units, and Sheep/Goat units.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is provided for establishing Dairy units?
faqs.answer: A 50% subsidy on the cost of milch animals, availed as a loan, for establishing Dairy units of 2/3 milch animals.

faqs.question: How much subsidy is provided for establishing Piggery units?
faqs.answer: A 50% subsidy on the cost of livestock, with a maximum of ₹50,000 as financial assistance.

faqs.question: What is the subsidy rate for establishing Sheep/Goat units?
faqs.answer: A 90% subsidy on the cost of livestock, with a maximum of ₹88,200 as financial assistance.

faqs.question: When is the subsidy provided to the beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is provided three months after the purchase of livestock or disbursement of the loan, whichever is later, subject to verification by the concerned veterinary surgeon.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be 18 to 55 years old, residents of Haryana, belong to the Scheduled Caste community, and be unemployed.

faqs.question: Are there any educational qualifications required for applying?
faqs.answer: No mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements are needed.

faqs.question: Can someone who has previously availed benefits from any Departmental Scheme apply again?
faqs.answer: No, applicants who have previously availed benefits under any Departmental Scheme for establishing a livestock unit are not eligible.

faqs.question: Is there a training component in the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the department provides 11 days of Dairy husbandry training at the concerned Sub Division/District Level.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply online through the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/.
